Name: Cartonnage panel depicting a winged goddess
Description: Panel of cartonnage brightly painted with a depiction of a winged goddess, arms outstretched, holding the ostrich plume (symbol of Maat, 'what is right') in each hand, with schematic depictions of the heraldic plants of north (viewer's left) and south (viewer's right), and of open lotus flowers and buds below. A beaded border runs along top and bottom of the scene. Such panels were placed over the breast of the mummified body in richer Late Period and Ptolemaic Period burials.
